etymologies: late Middle English: from Low German fommeln or Dutch fommelen

definitions: use the hands clumsily while doing or handling something
move clumsily in various directions using the hands to find one's way

examples.text: Greg fumbled around in the closet and found his black jacket

definitions: use the hands clumsily to move (something) as specified

examples.text: she fumbled a cigarette from her bag

definitions: drop or lose control of (the ball), sometimes causing a turnover
shortDefinitions: drop or lose control of ball, sometimes causing turnover

definitions: (in other ball games) fail to catch or field (the ball, a pass, a shot, etc.) cleanly.
shortDefinitions: fail to catch ball etc. cleanly

definitions: express oneself or deal with something clumsily or nervously

examples.text: asked for explanations, Michael had fumbled for words

definitions: an act of using the hands clumsily while doing or handling something

examples.text: just one fumble during a tire change could separate the winners from the losers

definitions: an act of dropping or losing control of the ball, sometimes causing a turnover

examples.text: his fumble was recovered on the 6-yard line

shortDefinitions: act of dropping or losing control of ball, sometimes causing turnover

definitions: (in other ball games) an act of failing to catch or field the ball cleanly.
an act of managing or dealing with something clumsily

examples.text: we are not talking about subtle errors of judgment, but major fumbles

shortDefinitions: act of dealing with something clumsily
